item.title: Aptugo develops customized web software without requiring any training
item.description:
Aptugo, a software tool designed to help individuals without coding experience build websites, is currently in beta testing. Developed by the company Aptugo, the software is expected to launch in 2015. “Aptugo has the potential to bridge the gap between large and small businesses. Users don’t need any programming knowledge to use it,” stated Gaston Gorosterrazu, Head of Aptugo. “However, those with coding experience can further enhance what Aptugo can do, as it is designed to empower users and expand their capabilities...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/aptugo-develops-customized-web-software-without-requiring-any-training/

item.title: Alternative uses for existing products
item.description:
A client needed a system to track expenses online. They were looking for a basic solution and found the popular options too expensive. While searching for alternatives, I realized they already owned a software called Project Accounting, but weren’t using its expense features. We decided to implement the Time and Expense portion of their existing software to meet their needs. This was a much more affordable option, especially since they didn’t need the full functionality of the software...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/alternative-uses-for-existing-products/

item.title: Emirates introduces a mobile site in Arabic language
item.description:
Emirates has introduced an Arabic version of its mobile website. This platform allows customers to book flights, check in online, upgrade their travel class, and access and download Apple Passbook boarding passes directly to their smartphones, regardless of the language they use on the Emirates mobile site. The Arabic mobile platform has been launched concurrently in 15 countries across the Middle East and North Africa, including the UAE, Bahrain, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Egypt, Morocco, and Sudan...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/emirates-introduces-a-mobile-site-in-arabic-language/
